I have verified this on Linux-GTK and WindowsXP.

TableWrapLayout throws a NullPointerException when computing cell sizes if a cell has no contents.  The end of the traceback is as follows:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.TableWrapLayout.calculateMinimumColumnWidths(TableWrapLayout.java:756)
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.TableWrapLayout.internalGetMinimumWidth(TableWrapLayout.java:701)
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.TableWrapLayout.layout(TableWrapLayout.java:230)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.updateLayout(Composite.java:1133)

calculateMinimumColumnWidths() assumes that every cell in the grid contains a TableWrapData object.  However, if a cell is empty the grid contains 'null' instead.  I determined the source of the null value is the logic in TableWrapLayout.createGrid(), line 466 and 473-477.

The attached code demonstrates the problem.  In createGrid(), if an element is too wide to fit in the remaining space on a row, it is moved to the next row.  This is what leaves the null value in the grid.  The attached example uses the smallest table that can yield this: 2x2 table with a 1x1 item in the first cell followed by a 2x1 item.  The upper-right corner of the table is empty.  In the attached code, uncomment the two indicated lines to fill that cell and allow the view to be shown without an exception.
